    • Method Detail

      • calculateBodyPartStat

        public static int calculateBodyPartStat​(int incomingStandardStat,
                                        int bias,
                                        int randomness,
                                        int shiftStrength)
        Calculates one stat of a bodyPart based on the standardStat of the bodyPart, a bias, a randomness and a shiftStrength.
        Parameters:
        incomingStandardStat - The standardStat of the bodyPart which is manipulated to get the final stat.
        bias - A bias expressed as a percentage. '10' would shift the final stat 10% higher. '-10' would shift the final stat 10% lower.
        randomness - The magnitude of the random shift expressed as a percentage. '0' means no random shift of the stat. '10' means at most a 10% shift of the stat both into the positive and negative relative to the standard stat '100' means at most a 100% shift of the stat both into the positive and negative relative to the standard stat
        shiftStrength - Modifies the magnitude of the bias and random shift. Expressed as a percentage. '10' means halving the magnitude of the calculated shifts. '100' means no magnification of the calculated shifts. '200' means doubling the magnitude of the calculated shifts.
        Returns:
        the final calculated Stat.

      • calculateBodyPartStat

        public static int calculateBodyPartStat​(int incomingStandardStat,
                                        int bias,
                                        int randomness)

      • randomRange

        public static float randomRange()
        Generates a number between '-1' and '1'
        Returns:
        the random float between '-1' and '1'
